p: The in vitro antibacterial activity of the crude extract was evaluated using a panel of pathogenic strains including Gram-positive bacteria: Staphylococcus aureus (ATCC 6538, Rosenbach) and Listeria innocua (LMG 11387), Gram-negative bacteria: Escherichia coli (DH10B), Pseudomonas aeruginosa (PAO1), Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica (ATCC 13076), and Shigella sonnei (LMG 10473), and one fungal strain: Candida albicans (SC5314). The (frozen) storage, maintenance, and preparation of working culture suspensions were carried out following established procedures described in our previous studies [ 64].
